triples.name: Phonology
triples.relevance: The paper studies phonological and morphological processes, which are core concepts in phonology.

triples.name: Morphology (linguistics)
triples.relevance: The paper analyzes morphological processes alongside phonological ones as part of its theoretical framework.

triples.name: Regular language
triples.relevance: Strictly Local functions are defined as a subclass of subregular relations, building on formal language theory foundations.

triples.name: Finite-state transducer
triples.relevance: Subsequential transduction and FSTs provide the automata-theoretic foundation for modeling SL functions.

triples.name: Automata theory
triples.relevance: The paper uses automata-theoretic characterization to define Strictly Local functions through finite-state machines.

triples.name: Metathesis (linguistics)
triples.relevance: Metathesis is identified as one of the key phonological processes shown to be Strictly Local.

triples.name: Reduplication
triples.relevance: Local partial reduplication is one of the phonological processes analyzed and shown to be Strictly Local.

triples.name: Affix
triples.relevance: Affixation and general affixation processes are studied as examples of Strictly Local morphological processes.

triples.name: Formal language
triples.relevance: Strictly Local formal languages (McNaughton and Papert, 1971) provide the theoretical foundation for defining SL functions.

triples.name: Algorithmic learning theory
triples.relevance: The paper proposes a new learning algorithm that provably learns the class of ISL functions using strict locality as an inductive principle.
